CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1962, pg. 22 reads: "Two Great Ones - Connie Hawkins (left), star of the Pittsburgh Rens basketball team, who was voted the "Most Valuable Player" in American Basketball League, accepts a plaque from Charlie Cooper, former Duquesne University All-American and the first Negro to play in the National Basketball Association. Hawkins was honored by the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, last week, in ceremonies at the Civic Auditorium.  Cooper served as master of ceremonies. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pipers basketball player Connie Hawkins, receiving plaque and shaking hands with Chuck Cooper, in Civic Auditorium [Arena]
